group_1.textLeft: I see, so that is how this works...
If you want to catch these fish...@You have to do lure fishing.

group_1.textRight: That's correct.
Papa taught me how to do lure fishing...@Look.

group_1.textLeft: Ohhh, tons of lures!@They look so cool, too!

group_1.textRight: I brought these from my parents' home.
Mama was somewhat of a clean freak@and hated having live bait in the home,
so it was inevitable that we would have@to resort to using lures...

group_1.textLeft: You mean like this?

group_1.textRight: Goodness, how gross.
Now I am beginning to understand@how Mama felt.

group_1.textLeft: Well ain't that a net positive, then.
I just looked through all of the lures.@You have a large selection, don't you?
I have a feeling you can catch the fish@you're looking for with these.

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Thank you. Papa's collection@is just perfect.
I will catch them as swift as can be@and cook some delicious food!

group_1.textLeft: Can you cook, Nayuta?

group_1.textRight: It is something I have seldom done.
But I have heard cooking fish is simple@because it only involves grilling.
At the very least I can use a stove@and a grill.

group_1.textLeft: No, these are river fish, so removing@the guts is pretty difficult...

group_1.textRight: R-removing the guts?!@Is that something humans do...?

group_1.textLeft: The life of a human involves many such@things piled on top of one another...
And I don't just mean food...

group_1.textRight: I am so naive...@I don't think I can do that...
Before I even started fishing,@my plan has failed.

group_1.textLeft: I would like to say that the best way@to get used to it...is to practice,
but these fish are not easy to practice on@when they're so hard to catch...
Ah, then why not practice on the fish@we caught?
They're a different kind,@but we caught a bunch.
Good idea! They're big, so they should@be easy to practice on.

group_1.textRight: It is okay for me to use them?!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I was gonna handle them myself@later,
so you got my gratitude for savin' me@the time.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much!

group_1.textLeft: For teachin', though...I think Chika's@better suited than I am.
She is a nature guide after all!
That's right, I will teach you.

group_1.textRight: If you'd please.

group_1.textLeft: First you take the fish...@And hold it so its belly is face up.

group_1.textRight: Like this?
Oh my! It's going crazy!

group_1.textLeft: This one's a bit too lively still, isn't it.
(I wonder if teaching her how to@kill them is a good idea...)
(But we don't have any tools with us... I'm worried@about how fresh they'll stay when put in ice water.)
(If she is going to apologize, I should@make sure they are as fresh as possible...)
Okay, here we go...!

group_1.textRight: You hit it?! Why did you hit the fish?!

group_1.textLeft: If you hit it in the head and stun it,@it should calm down.

group_1.textRight: Oh my... It calmed down.

group_1.textLeft: It may be more trouble at home,@so let's start practicing right here.

group_1.textRight: Eh, h-hitting it? U-understood.

group_1.textLeft: Too weak.

group_1.textRight: Nnh...h-harder...? Thenâ€•

group_1.textLeft: Too weak.
For someone that can hear animals,@Chika is pretty ruthless, huh.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, she gives it her all, doesn't she?@Hell of a girl there.
[chara:305801:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!

group_1.textLeft: Something wrong?

group_1.textRight: ...No, just felt like we're bein' watched...
I don't sense any magic power around...@...Just my imagination...?
